page.title: 03Settlement Descriptions
page.content: 1.{THURCROFT}:Thurcroft is a village built entirely in the 20th Century.It was built to house miners when the colliery was opened.The houses are mostly Council or NCB owned.It is the largest settlement in the block with about 600 houses. 2.{LAUGHTON COMMON }:This village is similar to Thurcroft but smaller.It is almost all NCB housing and was built for miners at Dinnington Colliery. 3.{BROOKHOUSE}:This is a small hamlet built along a stream.It is almost all stone-built houses and very rural. 4.{LAUGHTON}:Laughton is nearly as large as Thurcroft.Part of the village is old with stone buildings.There is a large private estate and some 20th Century terraced housing. 5.{BRAMPTON}:Brampton is an old village with about 50 stone cottages and houses.There are also 2 farms.
